Module InventoryManagement
Package com.inventory.modifyproduct

Class AddModifyProductController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.inventory.data.datamodel.Validator
      • com.inventory.modifyproduct.AddModifyProductController
  • public class AddModifyProductController
extends Validator
    Controller for FXML file addmodifyproduct.fxml Contains all event handling for Add/Modify Product form. Extends the Validator class, to gain its functionality and aid in textField Validation.

      • getAssociatedParts

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> getAssociatedParts()
        Getter for associateParts list.
        Returns:
        Returns associateParts

      • addAssociatedPart

        public void addAssociatedPart​(Part part)
        Adds a Part to associateParts list.
        Parameters:
        part - Part to be added.

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Called when the addmodifyproduct.fxml files is initialized. Checks whether or not the product is to be modified or if it is added, and then populates the form if applicable, or creates a new productId if applicable.

      • addPartToAssociatedParts

        public void addPartToAssociatedParts()
        Adds the selected part from the availablePartsTable to the associatedPartsTable or displays an error message if no parts have been created yet.

      • removePartFromAssociatedParts

        public void removePartFromAssociatedParts()
        Removes a part from the associatedPartsTable This method first displays a confirmation dialog to confirm the user's actions. A If the user confirms it removes the selected part from the associatedPartsTable as well as the associatedParts ObservableList.

      • addProductToInventory

        public void addProductToInventory()
        Checks for validity and completeness of all information in the Add/Modify Product form Uses the extended functionality of the Validator class to correct text input, and check input for validity. If The information is incomplete or invalid, displays an error message to the user stating the proper format, as well as input type for each field.

      • isValidProduct

        public boolean isValidProduct()

        This method tests whether or not the entries into the Add/Modify Product form's fields are complete and valid input.

        The test checks first that there is valid text entries into each of the text fields * located on the add/modify product form.

        The isDoubleValid(), isCSVTextValid(), and isIntegerValid() methods are members of the Validator class * which the Controller class extends. Each of these methods currently take a parameter which is required * to designate which field the method is validating. These overloaded methods only check for validity, but also * have an overloaded method which will correct the errors as well. this is used in textFieldValidator An alert message for each item that may be invalid is provided, even though they * currently are not all able to be used. This way if a change is made to the Validator class, which no longer * corrects the invalid text, or if a bug is introduced, the user will receive a Alert that informs them of their * errors and directions on how to provide valid input.

        Returns:
        The method returns true if all text is complete and valid according to data type, and false otherwise.

      • textFieldValidator

        public void textFieldValidator​(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)

        Validates and checks for proper format of Data types

        This method is used for validation of text fields. It checks for event type, then validates * based on the source based on what data should be in the field.

        The variable "source" refers to the source of the event, must be a TextField.

        Parameters:
        event - Must be called by an event listener that passes a KeyEvent, and the source must be a TextField.

      • searchParts

        public boolean searchParts()
        Searches for parts based on the partID or the partName. Automatically selects the part associated with the partName or partId. If the part input is an integer, it searches by Id first then by name, if the input is non-integer it searches only by name.
        Returns:
        returns true if part is found, returns false if part is not found.

      • searchPartsOnEnter

        public void searchPartsOnEnter()
        When the user presses enter while typing in a part name or ID, if part is not found, displays a "No Parts Found!" message. Uses the searchParts() method and if the method returns false, displays an informational message alerting the user that the part is not found

      • exit

        public void exit()
        Adds functionality to the cancel button to close the window, as well as store the current partIDIndex and set PassableData.modifyPart to false.
